summary: The Firearms Congressional Notification Modernization Act aims to amend the Arms Export Control Act regarding firearm export licenses. It increases the financial threshold that triggers notification requirements to Congress. Specifically, it raises the threshold for notification from $1,000,000 to $4,000,000 for firearm exports under category I of the United States Munitions List. The bill is sponsored by Mr. Self and was introduced in the House of Representatives on June 12, 2025.
